definition: lit. to burn both fragrant orchids and stinking weeds (idiom); fig. to destroy indiscriminately the noble and common/the rain falls on the just and unjust alike
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)
Chinese mugwort or wormwood/moxa/to stop or cut short/phonetic "ai" or "i"/abbr. for 艾滋病[ai4 zi1 bing4], AIDS
to mow/to cut/to reap/to redress
surname Ai
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
to burn
rooted to the spot (idiom); too terrified to move
knife, saw, ax and hatchet (idiom); facing torture and execution
the morning dew will swiftly dissipate (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
to praise sb in his presence
to stir up trouble
(cf Book of Songs) How to fashion an ax handle? You need an ax/fig. to follow a principle/fig. to act as matchmaker
jade garden of celestial ruler/paradise
battle-ax and boiling cauldron (idiom); facing torture and execution
sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds
birdlime
abbr. for Yupian 玉篇[Yu4 pian1] and Guangyun 廣韻|广韵[Guang3 yun4]
to blaspheme/to profane
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
cage (for animals)
variant of 夥頤|夥颐[huo3 yi2]
lit. to kill the tiger and behead the scaly dragon
